### Das Review {data-width=50}

<div class="container">
<div class="box30">
```{r, fig.width=5}
####### MAKE MEAN HORIZONTAL LINE ###
# https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52713272/adding-a-mean-to-geom-density-ridges


data_p <- data.frame(x = c(rnorm(500, 1, 1), rnorm(500, 0, 1)),
                     gr = c(rep("mit Kollaborationsskripts", 500), rep("ohne Kollaborationsskripts", 500)))

means_p <- data_p %>%
  group_by(gr) %>%
  summarize(xmean = mean(x)) %>%
  ungroup()


p <- ggplot(data_p, aes(x=x, group = gr, fill = gr)) + 
         geom_segment(aes(x=means_p$xmean[1], y=0, yend=.352, xend=means_p$xmean[1]), color = "#BD700F", size = 2) +
         geom_segment(aes(x=means_p$xmean[2], y=0, yend=.352, xend=means_p$xmean[2]), color = "#BD222F", size = 2) +
         geom_density(alpha = 0.5, colour = NA, adjust = 2) +
         # geom_vline(xintercept = means_p$xmean[1], colour = "#47AEB3") +
         # geom_vline(xintercept = means_p$xmean[2], colour = "#B36D3E") +
         theme_minimal() +
         scale_fill_manual(values = c("#BD700F", "#BD222F")) +
         xlab("Punkte im Leistungstest") +
         ylab("Dichte") +
         theme(legend.position = c(0.13, 0.9),
               legend.background = element_rect(fill=NA, 
                                                size=0.5, 
                                                colour=NA,
                                                linetype="solid"),
               legend.title = element_blank())

p
```

### Cohen's $U_3$

```{r}
gauge(84, min = 0, max = 100, symbol = '%', gaugeSectors(
  success = c(80, 100), warning = c(40, 79), danger = c(0, 39)
))
```
84.1% of the "treatment" group will be above the mean of the "control" group

### % Overlap

```{r}
gauge(62, min = 0, max = 100, symbol = "%", gaugeSectors(
  success = c(41, 50), warning = c(21, 40), danger = c(0, 20)
))
```
61.7% of the two groups will overlap

### Probability of Superiority

```{r}
gauge(76, min = 0, max = 100, symbol="%", gaugeSectors(
  success = c(0, 100)
))
```
There is a 76% chance that a person picked at random from the treatment group will have a higher score than a person picked at random from the control group

### Number Needed to Treat
```{r}
valueBox(2.8, 
         icon = "fa-user-plus", 
         caption = "Number needed to treat: In order to have one more favorable outcome in the treatment group compared to the control group, we need to treat 2.8 people on average",
         color ="#deb787") #18bc9c 
```
